snippet: Factions in the Chinese leadership had lacked a dominant elder statesman like Jiang Zemin to arbitrate disputes.
abstract: Former Chinese president Jiang Zemin is thrusting himself back into China's important political decisions and has emerged as dominant figure shaping future leadership; has worked behind the scenes, voicing frustration with record of his successor Hu Jintao, and positioning his proteges to dominate the Communist Party's incoming ruling group. (Series: Changing of the Guard)

byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting, and Amy Qin contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Factions in the Chinese leadership had lacked a dominant elder statesman like Jiang Zemin to arbitrate disputes.

headline.print_headline: Long Retired, Ex-Leader of China Asserts Sway Over Top Posts
headline.seo: Jiang Zemin, Ex-Leader of China, Reasserting Sway
headline.main: Long Retired, Ex-Leader of China Asserts Sway Over Top Posts

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
